episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" features facts about Charles Hortry's unusual bedstead collection, cheetah racing in 1937, a supercomputer built from PlayStation 3s, and a man who accidentally shot himself with a bow and arrow in 1552. The hosts discuss various quirky historical anecdotes and technological curiosities.

facts.fact: The actor Charles Hortry hoarded bedsteads in his house, thinking that one day he would make his fortune from them.
In 1937, you could visit Romford Dog Track and watch cheetahs racing.
In 2010, the US military built a supercomputer out of 1,760 PS3s.
In 1552, a man in England managed to shoot himself to death with a bow and arrow.
